content: star outline a free crochet pattern by kati gálusz © 2024 kati gálusz you are very welcome to sell finished items made with this pattern but please give me credit for the design please do not copy share sell post or distribute in any way the pattern itself or parts of it thank you for respecting the work that has gone into the design 2 these one-row stars are very fast to crochet and they would look great hanging on the christmas tree adding a personal touch to gift wraps strung into garlands glued on cards used as appliques - the possibilities are endless size my stars with sport weight cotton schachenmayr catania 125m/50g and 2 25mm us size b hook came out a little under 6cm 2 ¼ tall you can use thicker or thinner yarn for different sizes tools and materials ● yarn or thread about 3 5m / 4yd if using sport weight with c hook - any weight it will only influence the finished size ● hook matching your chosen yarn i suggest using a hook 1-2 size smaller than the yarn label s recommendation for tight and firm stitches ● pair of scissors yarn needle ● for starching pva glue white glue elmer s glue or decoupage glue small jar or bowl paintbrush corrugated cardboard covered in plastic wrap and pins abbreviations us uk/aus chain chain or chains c-decrease corner decrease see special stitches and techniques c-increase corner increase see special stitches and techniques single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet notes the pattern is written with us terminology see the table above for the uk/australian equivalents instructions in square brackets must be repeated the specified number of times before continuing with the remaining instructions of the row if you prefer printed patterns but want to save ink and paper you can print the appendix only page 6 - it contains the crochet instructions without photos a free pattern by kati galusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation 3 special stitches and techniques back bumps of chains when you look at a row of chains the front side is like a series of tiny vs fig a and the back has a single line of loops called back bumps fig b for the best look work into the back bumps rather than into one of the top loops corner decrease c-decrease this is essentially a decrease stitch with a chain skipped between the two legs of the decrease insert your hook in the next chain and pull up a loop fig c skip the 2nd chain insert your hook in the 3rd chain and pull up a loop 3 loops on hook fig d yarn over and pull through all loops on hook fig e corner increase c-increase single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in the next foundation chain
